   width: 62px;}</style>		<div class="ad placement">																				<!--  Begin gpt-skin/inread -->				<div id="inread" class="ad-container">									</div>								<!--  End gpt-skin/inread -->																 	  	</div>																																																									<div id="drr-container" class="cat" itemprop="articleBody">					<p>ZeniMax Online either has an impeccable sense of timing, or it’s so lucky that all its employees should go buy lottery tickets this second. The smoke and memes have barely cleared in the aftermath of last night’s series finale of <i>Game of Thrones</i>, and yet, mere hours later, ZeniMax is kicking open the gates of early access for <i>Elder Scrolls Online</i>’s <i>Elsweyr</i> expansion ahead of its official release next Monday. (Only for PC and Mac users, though—if you’re on a console, you’ll have to wait until next week.)</p><aside class="emo emo-sb"><h6 class="nav-title">Mentioned in this article</h6><div class="product-details"><figure class="productFigure"><span><img style="height: 106.828px; width: 75px; background: #000"></span><span class="product-name" data-productid="1442838">The Elder Scrolls Online: Elsweyr - PC Standard Edition</span></figure> <div class="product-lines"><div class="product-line2"><div class="price-msrp"><a class="product-list-price" href="http://buy.geni.us/Proxy.ashx?TSID=14154&GR_URL=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FElder-Scrolls-Online-Elsweyr-PC-Standard%2Fdp%2FB07MTZW4CJ%3Fpsc%3D1%26SubscriptionId%3DAKIAIVYSMSQJCH4VBFJA%26tag%3Dpcworld02-20%26linkCode%3Dxm2%26camp%3D2025%26creative%3D165953%26creativeASIN%3DB07MTZW4CJ%26ascsubtag%3DUS-001-3396184-005-1442838-web-20" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" data-product-name="The Elder Scrolls Online: Elsweyr - PC Standard Edition" data-vars-product-name="The Elder Scrolls Online: Elsweyr - PC Standard Edition" data-vars-link-position-id="005" data-vars-link-position="Product Sidebar" data-po="amazon" data-vars-outbound-link="https://www.amazon.com/Elder-Scrolls-Online-Elsweyr-PC-Standard/dp/B07MTZW4CJ?psc=1&SubscriptionId=AKIAIVYSMSQJCH4VBFJA&tag=pcworld02-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B07MTZW4CJ" data-product-id="1442838" data-vars-product-id="1442838" data-bkc="Gaming" data-bkmfr="Bethesda" data-vars-bkmfr="Bethesda" data-bkvndr="Amazon" data-vars-bkvndr="Amazon">$59.99</a><span class="msrp" style="">MSRP $59.99</span></div><a class="btn-amazon" href="http://buy.geni.us/Proxy.ashx?TSID=14154&GR_URL=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FElder-Scrolls-Online-Elsweyr-PC-Standard%2Fdp%2FB07MTZW4CJ%3Fpsc%3D1%26SubscriptionId%3DAKIAIVYSMSQJCH4VBFJA%26tag%3Dpcworld02-20%26linkCode%3Dxm2%26camp%3D2025%26creative%3D165953%26creativeASIN%3DB07MTZW4CJ%26ascsubtag%3DUS-001-3396184-005-1442838-web-20" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" data-product-name="The Elder Scrolls Online: Elsweyr - PC Standard Edition" data-vars-product-name="The Elder Scrolls Online: Elsweyr - PC Standard Edition" data-vars-link-position-id="005" data-vars-link-position="Product Sidebar" data-po="amazon" data-vars-outbound-link="https://www.amazon.com/Elder-Scrolls-Online-Elsweyr-PC-Standard/dp/B07MTZW4CJ?psc=1&SubscriptionId=AKIAIVYSMSQJCH4VBFJA&tag=pcworld02-20&linkCode=xm2&camp=2025&creative=165953&creativeASIN=B07MTZW4CJ" data-product-id="1442838" data-vars-product-id="1442838" data-bkc="Gaming" data-bkmfr="Bethesda" data-vars-bkmfr="Bethesda" data-bkvndr="Amazon" data-vars-bkvndr="Amazon">See it</a></div><div class="product-line3 vendor"><a href="http://buy.geni.us/Proxy.ashx?TSID=14154&GR_URL=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FElder-Scrolls-Online-Elsweyr-PC-Standard%2Fdp%2FB07MTZW4CJ%3Fpsc%3D1%26SubscriptionId%3DAKIAIVYSMSQJCH4VBFJA%26tag%3Dpcworld02-20%26linkCode%3Dxm2%26camp%3D2025%26creative%3D165953%26creativeASIN%3DB07MTZW4CJ%26ascsubtag%3DUS-001-3396184-005-1442838-web-20" rel="nofollow">on <span class="vendor-name">Amazon</span></a></div></div></div></aside><p><i>Elsweyr</i> is a perfect chaser for HBO’s tale of politics and fantastic beasts. You’ll see dragons, for one, and lots of them. You’ll find family members with decidedly different opinions about the invasion of a city, and you’ll even find an army of the undead worked into the mix. And if that all sounds a little <i>too</i> familiar, get this: <i>Elsweyr</i>’s also got a bunch of cat people. And we all know how much the Internet loves its cats.</p><figure class="large"><a class="zoom article-gallery cboxElement" href="https://images.idgesg.net/images/article/2019/05/khajiit-elsweyr-dragon-100796940-orig.jpg" rel="nofollow" title="<div class='credit'>ZeniMax Online</div><p>Watch the fur fly.</p>"><img style="height: 413.328px; width: 620px; background: #000"><div class="zoom-icon" style="background: rgb(0, 0, 0);"></div></a> <small class="credit">ZeniMax Online</small><figcaption><p>Watch the fur fly.</p></figcaption></figure><p>Other MMORPGs like <i>World of Warcraft</i> and <i>Final Fantasy XIV</i> make you spend ages grinding out earlier content before you reach cool new stuff like this, which can be a drag for new players. But not <i>Elder Scrolls Online.</i> You can start the game straight at the part with dragons as a Level 1, in fact, if you buy the <a href="https://www.elderscrollsonline.com/en-us/joinus" rel="noopener nofollow" target="_blank">$60 <i>Elder Scrolls Online: Elsweyr</i></a> edition. If you’ve already bought <i>ESO</i>, you can get <i>Elsweyr</i> with <a href="https://account.elderscrollsonline.com/store/product/eso_elsweyr_upgrade" rel="nofollow">a $40 upgrade</a>.</p><aside id="fsb-2093" class="fakesidebar fakesidebar-auto"><a href="https://www.pcworld.com/article/2449807/software-games/lose-days-of-your-life-to-these-13-deep-and-meaty-pc-games.html">[ Further reading: These 20 absorbing PC games will eat days of your life ]</a></aside><h2>Crouching tigers, barely hidden dragons</h2><p>I’ll chat more about the zombies and cats when my full review drops sometime next week (along with the new necromancer class—which is great). Today, though, let’s talk about the dragons.</p><p>In <i>Elsweyr</i>, dragons are a frightful sort, recalling both Daenerys’ beasts in <i>Game of Thrones</i> and the flying lizards of <i>Skyrim</i>. (So much so, in fact, that I wonder if the latter influenced the former.) Here they’re no one’s pet—not even you if happen to be an ambitious throne-seeker with silvery hair. They’re highly intelligent, too, as they switch from conversations in resonant academic English to violent chats in <i>Skyrim</i>’s dragon tongue without skipping a beat.</p><figure class="large"><a class="zoom article-gallery cboxElement" href="https://images.idgesg.net/images/article/2019/05/elsweyr-mulaamnir-100796941-orig.jpg" rel="nofollow" title="<div class='credit'>Leif Johnson/IDG</div><p>Just chatting about the weather, as you do.</p>"><img style="height: 413.328px; width: 620px; background: #000"><div class="zoom-icon" style="background: rgb(0, 0, 0);"></div></a> <small class="credit">Leif Johnson/IDG</small><figcaption><p>Just chatting about the weather, as you do.</p></figcaption></figure><p>They’re the indisputable masters of the food chain, and it doesn’t take long to figure out why earlier <i>Elder Scrolls</i> lore speaks of folks worshipping them as living gods for centuries. Indeed, <i>Elsweyr</i> helps put <i>Skyrim</i>’s Dovahkiin in context. The hero of that game could clobber dragons single-handedly with anything from knives to bare fists, while in this game I saw six players fall dead at once from a single blast of dragonfire. Twenty other players piled on the beast like ants on a sugar cube to minimal effect.</p><p>No wonder Whiterun guards speak of the Dovahkiin in awed tones when they’re not reminiscing about arrows in their knees.</p><h2>Such a drag</h2><p>But <i>Elsweyr</i>’s dragons are familiar for other reasons besides nostalgia, and that’s not necessarily a good thing. Our little pile-on made me realize that Elsweyr’s dragons are ultimately just new incarnations of the quasi-dynamic “Dark Anchors” and “Abyssal Geysers” that have enlivened <i>Elder Scrolls Online</i>’s open-world experience for around six years now.</p><aside class="nativo-promo nativo-promo-1 smartphone tablet desktop" id=""> </aside><p>In the case of Dark Anchors, three anchors drop from a portal in the sky, some monsters tumble out and try to knock you around, and then you and other players smite a final boss and scramble away with its loot. They’re great for leveling if you do them repeatedly, although that gets dull quickly.</p><figure class="large"><a class="zoom article-gallery cboxElement" href="https://images.idgesg.net/images/article/2019/05/elsweyr-dragon-fight-100796942-orig.jpg" rel="nofollow" title="<div class='credit'>Leif Johnson/IDG</div><p>Almost there!</p>"><img style="height: 349.031px; width: 620px; background: #000"><div class="zoom-icon" style="background: rgb(0, 0, 0);"></div></a> <small class="credit">Leif Johnson/IDG</small><figcaption><p>Almost there!</p></figcaption></figure><p>And so it goes with <i>Elsweyr</i>’s dragons, except they’re <i>always</i> the boss. Oh, they certainly leave a great impression, but only because they’re new. They fly around and roar and land in a cloud of dust. Sometimes they’ll briefly fly away from battles and lob fireballs from convenient perches, but they always come back for some more punishment. But much like Dark Anchors in other zones, they always plop down in the same three spots in <i>Elsweyr</i> (which I’ve taken to referring to as Drogon, Rhaegal, and Viserion).</p><figure class="large"><a class="zoom article-gallery cboxElement" href="https://images.idgesg.net/images/article/2019/05/elsweyr-perch-dragon-2-100796944-orig.jpg" rel="nofollow" title="<div class='credit'>Leif Johnson</div><p>Good spot for a rousing speech, I guess. Just don’t do it in the dragon tongue.</p>"><img style="height: 413.328px; width: 620px; background: #000"><div class="zoom-icon" style="background: rgb(0, 0, 0);"></div></a> <small class="credit">Leif Johnson</small><figcaption><p>Good spot for a rousing speech, I guess. Just don’t do it in the dragon tongue.</p></figcaption></figure><p>I guess it makes sense in some respects. You can’t have dragons terrorizing random stretches of this dusty, cat-filled landscape. It would ruin the careful storylines of other quests (and possibly bug them out). Maybe that was fine in single-player <i>Skyrim</i>—as that kind of thing happened frequently—but it could be an easy recipe for disaster in a massively multiplayer RPG. I worry, though, that this approach will make get these awesome beasts forgettable before too long. It’ll make them (sigh) <i>routine</i>. For now, though, players don’t seem all that worried.</p><p>“So dragons are basically the same thing as Dark Anchors?” I asked in chat in the closed beta last week.</p><aside class="nativo-promo nativo-promo-2 tablet desktop smartphone" id=""> </aside><p>“But with DRAGONS!” someone responded. A few gleeful responses followed. Fair enough.</p><figure class="large"><a class="zoom article-gallery cboxElement" href="https://images.idgesg.net/images/article/2019/05/elder-scrolls-online-dragon-100796945-orig.jpg" rel="nofollow" title="<div class='credit'>Leif Johnson/IDG</div><p>This is fine.</p>"><img style="height: 348.516px; width: 620px; background: #000"><div class="zoom-icon" style="background: rgb(0, 0, 0);"></div></a> <small class="credit">Leif Johnson/IDG</small><figcaption><p>This is fine.</p></figcaption></figure><h2>A world of trouble</h2><p>This kind of familiarity probably only matters for people like me, who spend <i>way</i> too much time in this kind of game. If you just want to experience a thoughtfully written story with lots of dragons, political intrigue, and hordes of undead, <i>Elsweyr</i> is a logical followup for anyone needing more closure after <i>Game of Thrones.</i> And if you find the dragons do, in fact, get old, the entirety of the rest of <i>Elder Scrolls Online</i> is out there waiting to be explored in any order you wish.</p><figure class="large"><a class="zoom article-gallery cboxElement" href="https://images.idgesg.net/images/article/2019/05/elsweyr-dragon-stories-cropped-100796943-orig.jpg" rel="nofollow" title="<div class='credit'>Leif Johnson/IDG</div><p>And if you’re still not interested, there are cute dragon songs, too!</p>"><img style="height: 413.328px; width: 620px; background: #000"><div class="zoom-icon" style="background: rgb(0, 0, 0);"></div></a> <small class="credit">Leif Johnson/IDG</small><figcaption><p>And if you’re still not interested, there are cute dragon songs, too!</p></figcaption></figure><aside class="emo emo-sb"><h6 class="nav-title">Mentioned in this article</h6><div class="product-details"><figure class="productFigure"><span><img style="height: 106.828px; width: 75px; background: #000"></span><span class="product-name" data-productid="1442838">The Elder Scrolls Online: Elsweyr -
